chapter.title: Data Structures
chapter.para: This chapter will outline the data structures that have been created for the project.

section.title: struct PCB
section.para:
PCB The PCB structure contains the following values:
char name[8] - the name of the process (8 characters or less) int pclass - the class of the process (APPLICATION or SYSTEM) int priority - the priority of the process (between -127 and 128) int state - the state of the process (which queue it's in) unsigned char pstack[1024] - the memory stack of the PCB int memsize - the size of the memory space unsigned char *loadaddr - the load address of the memory unsigned char *execaddr - the executing address of the memory

section.title: struct PCBDLL
section.para:
PCBDLL The PCBDLL structure is a doubly linked list with a dummy header node. Each PCBDLL is essentially an individual node of the linked list with pointers to the previous and next nodes. The PCBDLL structure contains the following values:
struct PCBDLL *prev - the previous element in the list struct PCBDLL *next - the next element in the list PCB *contents - the PCB contents of the current node
